metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23017 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A security issue in nginx resolver was identified, which might allow an attacker who is able to forge UDP packets from the DNS server to cause 1-byte memory overwrite, resulting in worker process crash or potential other impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23017` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

nginx - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm1
nginx-common - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm1
nginx-core - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm1
nginx-extras - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm1
nginx-full - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm1
nginx-light - 1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Luis Merino, Markus Vervier, Eric Sesterhenn

criterions.comment: nginx package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.3-0ubuntu0.16.04.5+esm1').
